frameDefinitions: This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
An Entity develops from a Prior_state to a Post_state.
This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote Instances of Types of entities or events.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
frameExamples: Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.

The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and <t><fex name='Instance'>instances</fex></t> of management decisions being taken without team consultation had also increased .
He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.
The part of the <fen>Organism</fen> which is undergoing biological development.
The living thing whose <fen>Entity</fen> is undergoing development.
The relevant dimension of development.  Usually expressed by an entity-denoting adjective.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
A thing or episode of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of thing or event of which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
listRoleExamples: My name is <fex>Bond</fex>.
<fex>You</fex> have an unusual surname.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
<fex>Your socks</fex> don't match.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
The development <fex>of a human embryo</fex> is fascinating to study.
Rachel studies nervous system development <fex>in apes</fex>.
<fex>Embryonic</fex> development had been stunted by the disease.
<fex>Someday</fex> this bud will grow into a rose.
The cells were developing rapidly <fex>in the Petri dish</fex>.
I collected two <t>specimens</t> <fex>of this rare species</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> managed a feeble smile.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
<fex>Betty</fex> bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.
Betty bore Gerry <fex>three intelligent daughters</fex>.
Betty bore <fex>Gerry</fex> three intelligent daughters.
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
